title: Strictly’s Kelvin Fletcher branded ‘filth’ by Craig Revel Horwood as judges go wild
text:
Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse on Strictly (Picture: BBC/PA Wire)

Kelvin Fletcher left the Strictly Come Dancing judges in a heated state, with Craig Revel Horwood even branding their sensual dance ‘filth’.

The 35-year-old Emmerdale star danced a Rumba with partner Oti Mabuse to Ain’t No Sunshine by Bill Withers on the latest live show.

After getting the judges hot under the collar with his Samba in week one, Kelvin managed to work his magic again with Shirley Ballas, Motsi Mabuse, Craig Revel Horwood and Bruno Tonioli.

Speaking after his dance, Craig said: ‘Well you’re obviously in touch with yourself darling. We can certainly see that.

‘It was full of machismo which I loved. It oozed masculinity. It was filth.’

As the judges cackled, Motsi joked: ‘I don’t know, you know. I’m just like, hold on Kelvin that’s my sister, stop it!

Craig didn’t know what to say (Picture: BBC)

‘In my house you’re called Kelvin the Samba, but now you’re Kelvin the Rumba. Well done guys, so much good quality in there. Beautiful dancing.’

The dance however didn’t quite achieve the 38 he scored last week, earning nine’s across the board for a total of 36.

Strictly Come Dancing continues on Sunday BBC One.
